caption: Beautiful Cathedral in Paris. It is a separate entrance from Napoleons Tomb, but you can see some of the church through the glass. The church is focused on the French Military and was built in the 1600’s. Amazing statues, art work, and structure. I really enjoyed the architecture. It has a veterans chapel and the graves of many officers from the French Military. We really enjoyed the visit. A must see in Paris if you enjoy history.
Bucket list church to visit! Napoleon is entombed here! A must see! 15 euros to enter. Gate on one side to enter on side street. Tomb on lower level.

It was very challenging to find the entry points. Once you do, you have to go through security checks. Once you pass the security checks, you can choose where to go because there are other attractions like the army museum and so on. We wanted to go to the Cathedral because it was free and other attractions were not. The Cathedral resembles a pro war atmosphere perhaps because it is for the military. The architecture is remarkable. The art and information provided is great. The places are clearly marked. I believe this cathedral is the only free attraction in this compound or building even going to see the tomb of Napoleon demand the cost ...

Also known as the soldiers church, this cathedral honors soldiers and military personnel. Very beautiful interior, though not completely outstanding compared to the more lavish cathedrals out there. Free entry and great for a quick walk around inside. Budget 5-10 minutes visiting time.
Cathedral on king saint Louis in France … around it the Musée de l Arme … and you will find at the ground floor the tomb of Nabeleon ….

During the monarchy,the emblems taken from the enemy were exposed to the vaults of Notre-Dame de Paris Cathedral. From the French Revolution ,they are gathered in the church of Invalides, wich ceases to be a place of worship. At the time of Napoléon ,the mass is reintroduced and,because of the numerous victories of the imperial armies,more than 1400 flags are deposited in the church. They were burned in the courtyard of the Invalides in 1814, during the invasion of France,on the orders of Marshal Sérurier ,governor of the Hotel ,so that they did not fall into the hands of the enemy. Ashes and remains are thrown into the Seine .

t's a beautiful cathedrale but what makes it even special is the overall setting of Les Invalides. It is located in the same complex that houses Musée de l’Armée des Invalides and Tomb of Emperor Napoleon. There are many artifacts inside the cathedrale that are worth a second look. It would take more than three hours to visit all places in Les Invalides
Very nice Cathedral, filled with light, you can see the alter of Napoleons tomb behind.
Spent hours here- very cool place
Admission is free 😊

Saint-Louis-des-Invalides, located in Paris, France, is a stunning Baroque-style Catholic cathedral that forms an integral part of the Hôtel des Invalides complex. Built between 1679 and 1708, the cathedral was designed by architect Jules Hardouin-Mansart and serves as a place of worship for the soldiers and veterans housed at the Hôtel des Invalides, a military hospital and retirement home. The church is notable for its grandiose architecture, characterized by its impressive dome, which is one of the most recognizable features of the Parisian skyline.  The interior of Saint-Louis-des-Invalides is equally magnificent, featuring an opulent altar, intricate marble work, and beautiful stained glass windows. The church is also home to the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte, housed under the iconic dome, which adds a significant historical and cultural dimension to the site. Saint-Louis-des-Invalides stands as a remarkable example of French Baroque architecture and a symbol of the nation's military history, drawing visitors from around the world who come to admire its beauty and pay homage to its historical significance.
Beautiful from the outside. Nice green area in front of it, for chilling

It is on a huge land. No toilets are available wo ticket, no exit, where it is the sign, you should walk back minutes back to the entrance. Poorly orginized museum, disappointing. Worst experience in Paris.
It's very beautiful place.
The monumental dome is inspired by St. Peter's Basilica in Rome.
Beautiful Cathedral. Lots to see including Napoleon tomb.
Very important place to understand the history of France.
One of the most stunning monuments in Paris.
very informative.

Magnificent place

The Cathedral of the Invalides, officially known as the Cathédrale Saint-Louis-des-Invalides, is part of the Les Invalides complex in Paris. The building was built in the XIV. Lajos built it at the end of the 17th century, originally as a chapel for a hospital and retirement home for military veterans. The cathedral is one of the most characteristic elements of the building, its gilded dome is clearly visible from afar, and it is one of the iconic landmarks of Paris.  Under the cathedral is the tomb of Emperor Napoleon, which is one of the main attractions of the place. The Cathédrale Saint-Louis-des-Invalides is also a symbol of French military glory and is the resting place of many other famous military leaders.

A place with a very beautiful classic design. It contains a collection of coffins of French leaders throughout the ages. The glass ceilings are very beautiful. The geometric designs are very splendid and luxurious. There is a restaurant opposite it and a café that is worth a visit.

This solemn place marked by its religious vocation dedicated to Christianity, by 300 years of history and by the proximity of the military pantheon, allowed me to live an experience open to eternity. Recommended for personalized introspection

It's a beautiful and interesting place but, honestly, Paris has other places that are much more attractive. I went there because they talk a lot about Napoleon's tomb, which is inside, but I couldn't access that part. It was banned. But strangely enough, I saw a group of people coming in anyway. I don't know what the criteria is for letting some people visit the tomb and others not.
Sumptuous cathedral. . Very moving as you enter the cathedral.

The lavishness, beauty and coldness of a building that can be so spiritual at the same time is surprising. Napoleon is, his body, or what remains of him, among cryptic cold stones and yet the majesty of such a relevant character in history seems to surprise. The place is beautiful, every detail is worthy of study and observation. The entire tour is to delight in history. Enjoy the beauty of the stone that gives luxury to death.

An incredible place, the museum of weapons and world wars is great. One hour is not enough. You can spend half the morning perfectly. The price seems expensive but once inside it is worth it. Few people and well organized.

A beautiful cathedral with a golden dome. Where you can find the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte, the army museum for those interested in the history of World War 2. Free for children under 25. The ticket is also valid for the army museum.

This cathedral is truly worth the visit. Its golden dome is a symbol that stands out in the center of Paris. The structure is bright and imposing, in full neoclassical style. The jewel in the crown is Napoleon's sarcophagus preserved in the royal chapel, a monument with a strong aesthetic impact.
Very beautiful, bright cathedral within the Hôtel des Invalides. To do during your visit to the army museum, the dome and Napoleon’s tomb.
Very impressive cathedral, the visit is interesting and well told, I recommend. There are lots of rabbits in the surrounding lawns, it’s so cute 🐰 …

For invalids, this place is for spending the day visiting museums, it has at least 6 within the same building, each one is paid separately for about €14 each, with the Museum Pass or Paris Pass you do not pay, access is free. Very close is the spectacular Rodin museum, the latter keep in mind that it is not open on Mondays.
There are Chinese explanations at every point in the entire church. Very satisfied!
It is the beautiful chapel of the hotel des Invalides, also known as the "church of the soldiers". Inside you can see the many flags that were conquered in battle. The dome is beautiful.
Beautiful church. It is a place full of many stories.
Impressive structure for its architecture, its spirituality and especially for the honor granted to French heroes

Church accessible through the courtyard of honor and which is used on the death of a soldier. The interior is imposing and benefits from natural lighting which allows good visibility, beautiful organ.
